a figure and so regularly shaped. <s>As<\s> For my own part <s>self <\s>,
I don’t question but it was <s>hung up <\s> Suspended in the Bladder 
of the Patient, where it <s>might be con <\s> might be 
<s>formed <\s> framed by the Urine; the dried membranous fila-
-ments <s>dried up <\s>, which are still perceived on the extremities 
of some of the Branches, are a new proof of this
conjecture; the Stone happening afterwards to 
loosen itself, may have occasioned to the Patient 
all those Symptoms that befell him at last, and
afterwards death itself. This opinion may 
appear extraordinary to <s>the <\s> able<s>st<\s> Lithotomist 
and I willingly submit it to their better understan 
ding.
Salien, Surgeon.

Mr. Salien of a 
rugged Stone. by S.H.S.
answer.
(B.)
March 18. 1735
Origl. entered in LB.
Pr. no. 450.
